channel.title: Calling a void from a client?

item.title: Calling a void from a client?
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.source: Calling a void from a client?

item.title: Calling a void from a client?
item.dc:creator: @Project_Evolution Project Evolution
item.description:
@Project_Evolution wrote:

If you still want the noclip in place, just get rid of the teleportToX and teleportToY variables and just leave it as is. Noclip is a client command, so you should be able to use it properly after you get rid of those two variables.

Read full topic
item.source: Calling a void from a client?

item.title: Calling a void from a client?
item.dc:creator: @needhoster needhoster
item.description:
@needhoster wrote:

I’m trying to fix ::noclip, but whenever I do ::noclip, it teleports me to a black place. Here’s my code: if (command.equals("noclip") && playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("radi")) { teleportToX += 103; teleportToY -= 52; } And here’s what’s in my client: [code]public void noclip()
{
for(int k1 = 0; k1 < 4; k1++)
{
for(int i2 = 1; i2 < 103; i2++)
{
for(int k2 = 1; k2 < 103; k2++)
aClass11Array1230[k1].anIntArrayArray294[i2][k2] = 0;

}

}
}[/code] and also if(aString887.equals("::noclip")){ noclip(); }

How would i call Public Void Noclip from my server files since its in the client files?

Read full topic
item.source: Calling a void from a client?
